Topic: Illustrate plants with and without water.
Evidence Statements: The student can draw a healthy plant with green leaves to show a plant with enough water.
The student can draw a wilted or brown plant to show a plant without enough water.
The student can include the sun in their drawing to represent that plants need light to live and grow.
The student can show the absence of rain or water in the drawing of the wilted plant to represent lack of water.
The student can illustrate a side-by-side comparison to clearly show the difference between a plant with water and a plant without water.
